question: Refer to BGP topology that is shown below. R1 and R4 have advertised their loopback interfaces into BGP: 192.168.1.1/32 and 192.168.4.4/32, respectively. Assume all BGP sessions are in Established state. Based on the outputs of routing tables of R1, R2, R3 and R4, which two statements are true and can be concluded?
options: The peering links 10.12.1.0/24 and 10.34.1.0/24 are in both R2's and R3's routing tables
R1's BGP table is missing the 192.168.4.4/32 prefix because the prefix did not pass R2's next hop accessibility check
The BGP best-path symbol is missing for the 192.168.1.1/32 prefix on R2 because the prefix did not pass R2's next hop accessibility check
The BGP best-path symbol is missing for the 192.168.4.4/32 prefix on R2 and for the 192.168.1.1/32 prefix on R3
correct_answers: The BGP best-path symbol is missing for the 192.168.1.1/32 prefix on R2 because the prefix did not pass R2's next hop accessibility check
The BGP best-path symbol is missing for the 192.168.4.4/32 prefix on R2 and for the 192.168.1.1/32 prefix on R3

question: Based on the OSPFv2 topology below, Area 34 is configured as Totally Not-So-Stubby Area, which default route type will be injected into Area 34?
options: O*N1 0.0.0.0/0 default route type 7 LSA from router R3
O*E2 0.0.0.0/0 default route type 5 LSA from router R3
O*IA 0.0.0.0/0 default route type 3 LSA from router R3
O*N1 0.0.0.0/0 default route type 3 LSA from router R3
correct_answers: O*IA 0.0.0.0/0 default route type 3 LSA from router R3

question: Which two statements are untrue regarding BGP Route Reflector (RR)?
options: If an RR receives an NLRI from an RR client, it will not advertise the NLRI to non-RR clients
Route Reflector solves the iBGP scalability issues within an Autonomous System (AS)
Route Reflector solves the eBGP scalability issues between Autonomous Systems (ASs)
The router that is receiving reflected routes is a route reflector client
If an RR receives a route from an eBGP peer, it advertises the route to RR clients and non-RR clients
correct_answers: Route Reflector solves the eBGP scalability issues between Autonomous Systems (ASs)
If an RR receives an NLRI from an RR client, it will not advertise the NLRI to non-RR clients

question: Refer to the exhibit. A network administrator in Autonomous System 65100 has set up a dual-homed BGP connection with an ISP. The administrator would like to ensure that all traffic from the ISP enters the Autonomous System through the router R1. Which BGP path attribute can the administrator configure on routers R1 and R2 to accomplish this?
correct_answers: Local preference

question: Study the EIGRP topology and output command below. Which statement is true and can be concluded from the output?
options: R3 is not enabled to perform unequal cost load balancing to destination 10.12.0.0/24
R3's variance parameter has not been modified from its default value
R3's Feasible Distance (FD) of successor is 768256 to network 10.12.0.0/24
R3's variance parameter has been modified from its default value
correct_answers: R3's variance parameter has been modified from its default value

question: Which two statements are true regarding iBGP?
options: Next hop remains unchanged when route is advertised to an iBGP peer
iBGP uses AS Path for loop prevention
AS Path is not prepended to the route when advertised to an iBGP peer
Next hop is changed when route is advertised to an iBGP peer
correct_answers: Next hop remains unchanged when route is advertised to an iBGP peer
AS Path is not prepended to the route when advertised to an iBGP peer

question: Based on the topology below, routing protocols are configured and working properly. Which command is required on router R3 to allow internal BGP routes to be redistributed into OSPF?
options: router bgp 64532 → bgp match internal external
correct_answers: router bgp 64532 → bgp redistribute-internal

question: Which address is used by an IPv6 EIGRP router as the source for Hello messages?
options: The IPv6 global unicast address configured on the interface
correct_answers: The interface IPv6 link-local address

question: Which two statements are true regarding IS-IS Overload bit?
options: Overload bit is configured on routers during startup to avoid traffic black-holes until convergence
If Overload-bit is set on both Level-1/Level-2 router, the router will allow both types of traffic
Value of Overload-bit is 1 if set and 0 if not set
If Overload-bit is set on a Level-2 router, other Level-2 routers continue using it for forwarding
correct_answers: Overload bit is configured on routers during startup to avoid traffic black-holes until convergence
Value of Overload-bit is 1 if set and 0 if not set

question: Which statement is untrue about the Designated IS (DIS) router in IS-IS?
options: DIS reduces adjacencies and flooding over LAN subnets
All routers establish adjacencies with DIS and backup DIS
DIS is elected based on interface priority
correct_answers: All routers establish adjacencies with DIS and backup DIS

question: Which statement is true about IS-IS routing protocol?
options: PSNP acknowledges receipt of an LSP, CSNP distributes the complete LSDB
Timers must match for adjacency to be established
IS-IS has three hierarchy levels and two adjacency levels
An IS-IS backbone is contiguous Level-1/Level-2 adjacencies
correct_answers: PSNP acknowledges receipt of an LSP, CSNP distributes the complete LSDB

question: How will seed metrics be applied to RIP and OSPF routes redistributed into EIGRP?
options: Only RIP routes redistributed with seed metric 170
Both RIP and OSPF redistributed with same seed metric
Only OSPF routes redistributed with seed metric 170
Both RIP and OSPF will not be redistributed
correct_answers: Both RIP and OSPF redistributed with same seed metric

question: On an ABR, how will the routing table change if Area 1 is configured as an OSPF Stub area?
options: None of the routes will be removed
Only O IA and O E2 subnet routes to 192.168.0.0 removed
All O IA and O E2 routes removed
correct_answers: Only O IA and O E2 subnet routes to 192.168.0.0 removed

question: Which two statements are true regarding Split Horizon on an EIGRP network?
options: Split horizon needs to be disabled on hub-and-spoke topologies
Split horizon is disabled by default on all interfaces
Split horizon is enabled by default on all interfaces
Split horizon needs to be enabled on hub-and-spoke topologies
Split horizon can only be disabled in global configuration mode
correct_answers: Split horizon needs to be disabled on hub-and-spoke topologies
Split horizon is enabled by default on all interfaces

question: OSPF internal and external routes are redistributed into BGP. What is the outcome?
options: BGP cannot process routes without a seed metric
All internal and external OSPF routes redistributed
correct_answers: All internal and external OSPF routes redistributed

question: Which class of BGP path attributes is recognized by all BGP implementations and is not advertised between ASs?
correct_answers: Well-known mandatory

question: Which two commands can be used to verify EIGRP IPv6 authentication?
correct_answers: show ipv6 eigrp key chain
show ipv6 eigrp interface detail

question: R2 must summarize Area 15 networks. What configuration is required?
Which statement is untrue about IS-IS routing protocol?
options: Router resides in a specific area
All routers are Level-1/Level-2 by default
correct_answers: All routers are Level-1/Level-2 by default

question: EIGRP network 10.10.0.1/32 is redistributed into IS-IS. Which statement is true?
correct_answers: Redistributed with seed metric 0

question: Which three statements can be concluded about OSPF Area 34?
options: External route 172.16.1.0/24 will not be injected
External route injected as Type 7 LSA
correct_answers: Area 34 blocks LSAs type 3, 4, and 5
External route injected as Type 7 LSA
Area 34 is Totally NSSA

question: Which two conditions will cause an EIGRP route to enter the Active state?
options: No feasible successor in routing table
No feasible successor in topology table
correct_answers: No feasible successor in topology table
The successor goes down

question: How is an inter-area summarized route inserted into the ABR routing table?
correct_answers: Discard route to Null0

question: Which two commands produced the OSPF output shown?
correct_answers: show virtual-links interface detail
show ip ospf virtual-links

question: Which two statements describe the result of the route-map configuration?
options: Matching prefixes set local preference to 250
Non-matching prefixes set local preference to 100
Prefix list has higher priority than weight
correct_answers: Matching prefixes set local preference to 250
Prefix list has higher priority than weight

question: Which two statements are true regarding OSPF NSSA?
options: ABR allowed to flood LSAs 4 and 5
ABR not allowed to flood LSAs 4 and 5
correct_answers: ABR not allowed to flood LSAs 4 and 5
Default route injected automatically

question: Which address will R1 use as the source for all OSPFv3 messages?
Which two statements are true regarding OSPFv3 Address Family?
options: 32-bit Router ID used regardless of IP version
IPv4 transports IPv4 AF, IPv6 transports IPv6 AF
IPv6 transports both IPv4 and IPv6 AF
correct_answers: 32-bit Router ID used regardless of IP version
IPv6 transports both IPv4 and IPv6 AF

question: Which two statements describe MP-BGP IPv6 differences vs IPv4?
options: IPv4 addresses cannot define BGP RID
IPv6 uses multicast to establish neighbors
IPv6 AF must be initialized and neighbor activated
IPv6-only routers must statically define BGP RID
correct_answers: IPv6 AF must be initialized and neighbor activated
IPv6-only routers must statically define BGP RID

question: Which two actions does EIGRP DUAL take when a link goes down?
options: Search topology table for feasible successor
correct_answers: Query neighbors
Search topology table for feasible successor

question: Which two BGP commands are required to peer using Loopback0?
correct_answers: neighbor <peer-lo0> remote-as <AS>
neighbor <peer-lo0> update-source lo0

question: Which OSPF command produced the output shown?
correct_answers: show ip ospf interface
